configureAll

public java.util.Collection<Configurable> configureAll()
                                                throws ConfigurationException
Configure all components of the simulator. The single components are either registered via the register(name, component) method or specified in the config file.

Returns:
a collection of components.
Throws:
ConfigurationException

parseValue

public java.lang.String parseValue(java.lang.String value)
Description copied from interface: Configurator
Parse value. If the argument starts with a $ sign then it will be interpreted as a variable name and the variable value will be returned. If the variable was not set the result will be null. If the argument contains no $ sign, the valueString parameter will be just forwarded as the return value.

Specified by:
parseValue in interface Configurator
Parameters:
value - - string to be parsed, either plain value or variable name with preceding $
Returns:
the value of the variable named valueString, null, or the valueString

getConfigurable

public Configurable getConfigurable(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: Configurator
Get a configurable which was already parsed and configured. This is the common way how configurables can access each other during the configuration process or how the simulation engine can obtain the configuration result.

Specified by:
getConfigurable in interface Configurator
Parameters:
name - - configurable's name (which is same as in the configuration file).
Returns:
configured configurable or null if there is no configurable with the given name

setVariables

public void setVariables(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> variables)
Set variables with values which replace the variable names in the configuration file. Default values will be overwritten.

Parameters:
variables -

parseTime

public static long parseTime(java.lang.String value)
Parse the time according to the following rule: value is a number followed by a "ms", "s", "m" or "h" for milliseconds, seconds etc.. The conversion is done according to the constants defined in the Simulator class.

Parameters:
value - - time value to parse
Returns:
parsed value
